name: elelpwi
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cpw(c2))), wcel(c0, c2))

stmt.origin: impcom(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wcel(c0, c2))
stmt.pretty: impcom(c0 ∈ c1, c1 ∈ P(c2), c0 ∈ c2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cpw(c2))), wcel(c0, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cpw(c2))), wcel(c0, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wss(c1, c2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cpw(c2))), wcel(c0, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cpw(c2)), wss(c1, c2))
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cpw(c2))), wcel(c0, c2))

comment: If ` A ` belongs to a part of ` C ` then ` A ` belongs to ` C ` . (Contributed by FL, 3-Aug-2009.)
